intro: Vaccinium hansmeyeri, commonly known as the Hansmeier blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like heathers and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically blue or purple in color, similar to other Vaccinium species. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid climate for optimal growth. The leaves are oval-shaped, glossy, and remain green throughout the year, contributing to its ornamental value.
